Has always been a great game from the day it was release until now.

One of the most iconic games of all time, and for good reason. Even to this day this game proves to be very fun and an overall enjoyable experience. Mechanics and concepts are well explained and many taught through situations instead of directly telling the player about them. There are some bugs (not as many as HL: Source, thank god), but this is to be expected running a 1998 game on modern machines. Graphics are very dated but this is only really noticeable at certain points and the controversial HD models for the weapons, items, and NPCs can be turned on at any point if you so desire (some prefer the HD models while others prefer the original ones, so my best recommendation is to try switching between the original and HD models to see which ones you like better). Overall, Half Life is one of the best games of all time and continues to be a fun experience for series veterans and new players alike.
This game is good, and it's cheap in steam sales, so if you have any spare money after you buy a game in steam sales, so you should pick this up too
my save got deleted but its still good i guess

Half-Life is without a doubt one of the most influential FPS games of all time. Even after being around for over 2 decades now, it's still worth checking out. The pacing for the most part was pretty good, the story is simple enough to understand, and the weapons are fun to experiment with and try out. Speaking of the weapons, they all handle very well for the situations they're designed for, and feel satisfying to use. Considering the game typically goes on sale for very cheap during some of Steam's bigger sales (Usually with the rest of the franchise), there's really no reason to not give Half-Life a try!
On a side note, I've beaten the game 3 times now. It's a good game to come back to every once in a while.
i'm a dumb fucking rock because the first ever puzzle had me stumped for 5 hours
i love this game, its great, but also i havent played it for to long and i cant close it please help
Raw gameplay. Epic scifi. Back when you really loved the games you played. A griping story full of style and sunstance. Play it, love it.

Half Life is a good game.
 It is certainly imperfect, but it's more than decent. Sure, the visuals have aged like milk, and some puzzles were too confusing to my tiny brain, but it was good.
If you're looking at this thinking "should i buy this?" I'd say so. Personally, i got it for a sale (about 2 bucks i think), so even if i stopped playing, it wouldn't have been much of a loss.
Also, the Xen levels aren't as bad as people say. Sure, they aren't great, but they're not bad.

QUALITIES: 
- Although the graphics haven't aged well, the sets and maps are pretty decent. 
- It's a good length, although I like my games short.
- Some parts are a great adrenaline rush.
- The weapon loadout is varied and- honestly- really odd (in a good way)
- The scripted sequences and its way of storytelling was insane for its time, and it still holds up pretty well.
- Surface Tension is a great level, although it's a little long for my liking.
- The voice acting is ever so slightly stale, and it's amazing.
- Good morning Gordon

THE BAD PARTS:
- Some puzzles straight up don't tell you what to do, so you may need a walkthrough, especially for On a Rail and onwards.
- On a Rail is the worst level. It's tedious and long. Feels like watching paint dry.
- Speaking of- the first 6 or 8 hours i put into this game ended up being of no use when the save file for that level corrupted. Worst experience I have had in gaming.
- The boss fight at the end was complete ASS. Look up a walkthrough for this one. 
- A lot of parts are very tedious.
- (this one is for the arena shooter players) DO NOT GO IN GUNS BLAZING. THINK ABOUT WHAT TO DO BEFORE YOU DO IT AND SAVE YOUR GAME A LOT.

The pros JUST outweigh the cons. Go play it, you *probably* will not regret it. Then get the second one, cause that one's supposed to be a lot better. 
RATING: 7.4/10
COMPLETED IN: 13-15 hours.

If you're a fan of FPS games, Half-life is a milestone which marked a fundamental shift in the industry, a shift in what everyone thought an FPS could or should be. Despite its age, the game still drips with atmosphere, and provides fun and interesting challenges around every corner. If you haven't given it a try, you're doing yourself a disservice.

Cause a cataclysmic quantum event and then run around in a goofy orange suit and beat up the military before you go fight a fetus in an alternate universe then you get abducted by a creepy briefcase man.

Half Life was amazing when it first came out and if you want to play it for nostalgia, curiosity or historic context, go for it. But it has aged quite badly. Play Black Mesa, the remake using the HL2 engine, instead before playing HL2 and Alyx.
